articles.headline: Who are the current NFL team owners?
articles.description: NFL team owners run the gamut from on the town to barely seen. Who is in charge of your favorite franchises? Check out this list for more details.

images.name: Jeffrey Lurie [608x342]
images.caption: Jeffrey Lurie's Philadelphia Eagles won Super Bowl LIX.

articles.headline: Why Colts owner Jim Irsay refused over $1B for his collection
articles.description: Irsay considered his collection priceless because the eclectic items possess personal -- as well as historic -- significance.

images.name: The amazing collection of Colts owner Jim Irsay [1296x729]
Muhammad Ali Belt - San Francisco Event [1296x729]
images.caption: After a bidding war that lasted over five hours, Jim Irsay finally landed Muhammad Ali's "Rumble in the Jungle" championship belt from his 1974 victory over George Foreman in Zaire (now Congo). The bid was $6.18 million.

images.name: Guitar Wall with Crowd - San Francisco Event [1999x1333]
images.caption: Irsay is a music aficionado with a vast guitar collection. One of the higher-priced items is the "Black Strat" formerly owned by Pink Floyd guitarist David Gilmour. It sold for $3.9 million.

images.name: JFK Stetson Hat - NYC Event Event [1999x1333]
images.caption: Irsay has collected items with unique historical significance, including a hat that former Texas governor John Connally was going to present to President John F. Kennedy in 1963. Kennedy was assassinated hours before Connally planned to present the hat.

images.name: AA Big Book - NYC Event [2000x1097]
images.caption: The original manuscript of the Alcoholics Anonymous "Big Book" holds personal significance for Irsay, whose father and grandfather dealt with alcoholism. Irsay has faced his own opioid addiction for decades.

images.name: JWB Wanted Poster - Washington DC Event [1727x1333]
images.caption: Irsay's collection features a wanted poster for John Wilkes Booth, who assassinated President Abraham Lincoln.

images.name: Beatles Drums Side - Chicago Event [1634x1333]
images.caption: Irsay paid $2 million for the bass drum with "The Beatles" on it used by Ringo Starr on "The Ed Sullivan Show" in 1964.

images.name: Jim Irsay opens up about his unique collection
images.caption: Indianapolis Colts owner Jim Irsay sits down to discuss his eclectic collection, which includes memorabilia from the Beatles.

articles.headline: Indianapolis Colts owner and CEO Jim Irsay dies at 65
articles.description: Jim Irsay, who had led the Colts since 1997 and presided over one of the storied franchise's greatest eras, died Wednesday.

articles.headline: Purdy 'extremely happy' with new 49ers contract
articles.description: Brock Purdy speaks about how the 49ers and his agent came to a number that satisfies both sides in contract negotiations.

images.name: Purdy 'extremely happy' with new 49ers contract
images.caption: Brock Purdy speaks about how the 49ers and his agent came to a number that satisfies both sides in contract negotiations.

articles.headline: Ben Johnson: Excited to change QB narrative with Bears
articles.description: Ben Johnson said he looks at the Bears' troubling track record of developing quarterbacks -- which resurfaced in reporting about Caleb Williams last week -- as an opportunity as he enters his first season in Chicago.

articles.headline: Brock Purdy on Niners deal: 'Exactly where we needed to be'
articles.description: Brock Purdy said his contract extension with the Niners wasn't about getting as much money as he could, but making sure the team could still build a good roster around him.

images.name: Purdy 'extremely happy' with new 49ers contract
images.caption: Brock Purdy speaks about how the 49ers and his agent came to a number that satisfies both sides in contract negotiations.
